relation: Great for these types of students

Great for students who currently live in Jacksonville and aren't ready to leave home yet from there parents or guardians. Great for students who have high GPA's, because they can always join Phi Theta Kappa (Honor Society) and have a lot of opportunities for scholarships.

Be organized and plan out your classes ahead of time. Don't overwork yourself, because it will create a lot of stress and you probably won't do well in your classes. Also, please and I mean please, choose your professors wisely!
When I went to FSCJ, they had reasonable prices if you're going for your A.A. or A.S. Degree. I don't know what the price range is for the Bachelor's Degree's at FSCJ, but I think it's reasonable.

I enjoyed being at FSCJ, because I had friends from high school that were there. Since I was going to FSCJ for my A.A. Degree, I had paced myself with my classes and before you know it I had graduated. During that moment, it was kind of bittersweet, because I was ecstatic to leave but I was going to miss the atmosphere of FSCJ.
The professors at FSCJ will teach you a lot of stuff that you don't even know. The work load for classes is mediocre, and it's definitely worth it when you go there.
pageTitle: Florida State College at Jacksonville Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {524675=Academics are about an average level of difficulty here, depending on what classes you have. I know that the French classes focus more on the grammar of the language than they do vocabulary, so it goes to show how you get a different sort of emphasis in some of the more traditional academics such as foreign language., 772417=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 298835=FSCJ is amazingly cheap, 4 classes this semester ended up being $1234.56, which was cheap and amusingly consecutive. Your education will be good, but that money is pretty much only going to pay for the faculty. Do not expect a shining campus or well-trained staff members. If you are looking to have the full college experience, look somewhere else. If you just want a degree and to enjoy your teachers, you have come to the right place., 677777=I love being a student here at Fscj. This is my second semester. I can't wait to accomplish my goals and graduate in 2017 as a registered nurse., 143690=I don't have any I start class May 14, 2012., 464842=Academic rigor is a little bit of an overstatement. You can learn here, and learn a lot, even if you are a very smart cookie. Getting an A often takes work, but as long as you turn everything in, you'll probably pass a lot of the classes, especially in English. Seems like people pass ENC1101 without knowing anything about MLA.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Maureen from Jacksonville, FL 03/26/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 9 out of 10 people found this review useful. 2 of 205 Categories Comments Great for these types of students First-time college students. Students looking for small class sizes and a high school feel. Students looking for a smaller, easier to navigate college. Students looking for friendly, accepting peers and understanding faculty. Students who want to test out the waters and find their major. Tips for prospective students This is a great school for first-time college students. If you happen to mess up, the faculty are more than willing to help out and try their best to give you advice. Most of the classes are very similar to high-school classes and due to the smaller class sizes, you get a lot more individual time with your professor to maximize learning. Bang for the buck For a school of this quality, it is definitely not as pricey as it
